- Android OS 9 introduces a restriction that allows each foreground application to scan Wi-Fi a maximum of 4 times per 2 minute period
- Please see Android documentation references below

### Android OS 9 Wi-Fi scanning permissions requirements 
- ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION
- CHANGE_WIFI_STATE
- ACCESS_WIFI_STATE
- Location services are enabled on the device
- Please see Android documentation references below

- ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION or ACCESS_COARSE_LOCATION or CHANGE_WIFI_STATE

title: Faster update time for graphs
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
It'd be nice if graphs could update more than once a second, so I don't have to pause after each antenna adjustment. WiFi hardware can get new signal quality data many times per second. How about an option to have the graphs update "as fast as possible"?


I could imagine someone saying CPU usage would be an issue. If so, perhaps there's a way to block while waiting for the WiFi hardware to have fresh data.

Another possible objection would be that graphs would scroll too fast. A good solution would be to switch to a graph that uses logarithmic time for the x-axis. Recent changes would take up the most space, with older samples essentially getting averaged together so they take up less.

title: Enhancement - Use modern Android APIs
body:
Hi guys

Your wonderful app has a little downside: still targets Lollipop APIs. Is there any particular reason for this?

Targeting Marshmallow and above would introduce many advantages like: backup of user settings, proper multi-window support, user (runtime) permissions, Quick Settings Tiles, App shortcuts and so on.

Many apps have moved forward newer APIs, it's a shame this wonderful app is being left behind!

title: Fix duplicate elimination in language selection
body:
Instead of using the Locale.getCountry() string as the stored preference
for the user's language selection, we should probably use
Locale.toString(). For example, this would means storing de_DE instead
of DE.

Otherwise, if the system Locale has the same country as a translation,
but a different language (something like en_DE), the actual German
translation (de_DE) is not shown in the preference list as it is
identified as a duplicate by the comparator used by
LanguagePreference.getData().

Fix it by replacing .getCountry() with .toString() at the relevant
places.

implement this.

first attempt at playing around with Android apps.
